title: Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of a Vertical Panel", ca. 1775
medium: Pen and black ink on paper with brush and ink washes
provenance: Collection of Léon Decloux. Entered Decloux's collection after 1906. Ex-coll. of Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896 for 215 francs.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Candelabrum composed of fantastic animals, a flower basket, cornucopiae, a sun head, surrounded by floral motifs. Drapery festoons are on top. Framed by mouldings, paper margins.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of a Vertical Panel", ca. 1775. Pen and black ink on paper with brush and ink washes. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-32.
